Texto: 
noncontributory.
management:
•generally asymptomatic
•complications- nephrolithiasis, obstruction, infection
•surveillance- association with wilms in children
•waiver required for military aviation
axial ct images of the kidneys-  “bouquet of flowers” pattern of calcification throughout the medullary pyramids
medullary sponge kidney (msk)
• benign tubular ectasia (medullary sponge kidney)

• other causes of medullary nephrocalcinosis:
» hyperparathyroidism
» renal tubular acidosis
» renal papillary necrosis
» primary hyperoxaluria
50 y.o. woman with non-specific abdominal pain.
